intro: Echites muricatus, commonly known as the rough echites, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Echites muricatus is often found in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
